climbs.name: Nightmare on Addie Street
climbs.fa: Bolted by Lee Terveen. FA: Carl Gostola

content.description:
Named after Carl's nightmare with road construction in front his house (Really? A whole YEAR to pave a freaking road?) this epic, little nightmare has a hard, bouldery start and a few dozen feet of SWEET moves that abruptly end at a roof pull from hell. 

  The nightmare begins with big, yet strange holds to a contortionistic foot placement that will set you up for a hellish deadpoint move to a creey crimp that is supposed to be there, but more than likely isn't. 

  Be prepared to take the ride to the twilight zone and back! This roof is a bitch. Take my advice, don't fall asleep, whatever you do, don't fall asleep! And be sure to do a few thousand pull-ups and eat your Wheaties before getting on this psycho-killer of a route.
content.location: Left most route on the left hand side of the wall.

climbs.name: Dr. Evil
climbs.fa: Bolted by Blake Workman. First sent by Mark "Mini-Lee" Ellefson

content.description:
Yet another devilishly handsome route that is often overlooked because The Courthouse Wall tends to keep most climbers busy for a life time. However, if the lines to the courthouse are long, this evil, little son-of-a-bitch will bring you just as much pleasure and pain as any route in the area. 

  A miserably evil start leads to really good sequences and moves on holds that are hard as hell to hold onto. Be prepared to battle a whole school of sharks, with lasers on their heads, and then pull over a bulge that becomes more difficult if you have a puddly paunch instead of a super agent six pack. 

  Don't wait in line for a Courthouse climb when you could be climbing this route and threatening the whole world with your self destruction! JUST about everyone in the Canyon Crew agrees that this is an experience worth at least one million dollars.
content.protection: 6 bolts. Be prepared for closed anchors.

content.description: Excellent sustained pocket pulling on mainly two finger pockets. there is a thin crux in the middle of the route on a couple small pockets but good feet. the black bulge finish is classic! this route is often overlooked because of the classic 12cs on the Courthouse wall. Get on it!
content.location: second route from the left, two to the left of buffalo bill

climbs.name: Buffalo Bill
climbs.fa: Bolted by Blake Workman. First Acsent done by Lee Terveen

content.protection: 6 bolts. Closed shuts. Soon to be replaced with more modern sport climbing anchors.
content.location: This climb is the right most climb on the wall and as of the time of this writing sports a red tag.

content.description:
Down the trail, just past the Courthouse Wall, is a little, hidden gem of a blonde wall with enough hard climbs to keep you busy till judgement day. 

  The routes are technical, physically demanding, a bit intimidating, and just like those cheesy horror movies of the 80's, these climbs have just enough scary moments to keep you on the edge of your rope.
